headline: US Loses Financing Edge as Asia Borrows in Euros: Credit Weekly
summary: Asia Pacific borrowers increased euro‑denominated issuance to a record 23% of the total across both currencies this year, up six percentage points from 2024, according to Bloomberg-compiled data.  Multiple Asian deals ranked as the most oversubscribed in Europe’s publicly syndicated debt market during their launch week, the data showed.  US dollar deals still make up the majority of financing deals, and borrowing in the greenback is up 29% by Asian issuers this year.
